tools.name: AgentRPC
tools.description: AgentRPC is a framework enabling communication and orchestration between AI agents and tools using a JSON-RPC protocol. It allows tools and skills to be packaged as Python classes and exposed to agents for question answering, workflow automation, conversational reasoning, and other interactions. Typical use includes registering "Skills" (toolkits) with method functions that can be invoked via structured prompts or API calls.

tools.name: MCP_Validator_CLI
tools.description: A command-line tool for validating Model Construction Process (MCP) definitions against the MCP specification standards used by APIMatic. This tool checks definition files (JSON/YAML) for correct structure, required fields, and compliance with the MCP specification. Sample usage includes: `apimatic-mcp-validator validate <definition-file>`. Typical keywords and queries: "validate MCP definition", "check JSON", "YAML compliance", "MCP standard validation".

annotations.title: Description of MCP_Validator_CLI. A command-line tool for validating Model Construction Process (MCP) definitions against the MCP specification standards used by APIMatic. This tool checks definition files (JSON/YAML) for correct structure, required fields, and compliance with the MCP specification. Sample usage includes: `apimatic-mcp-validator validate <definition-file>`. Typical keywords and queries: "validate MCP definition", "check JSON", "YAML compliance", "MCP standard validation".

tools.name: MCP_Validator_Core
tools.description: A Node.js/TypeScript validation library that programmatically validates MCP definition files. This library exposes functions to load MCP definitions, perform comprehensive validation, and output structured error messages. Useful for integration in build pipelines, CI/CD or editor plugins. Common queries: "Is my MCP file valid?", "Schema errors in MCP", "Validate MCP in CI".

annotations.title: Description of MCP_Validator_Core. A Node.js/TypeScript validation library that programmatically validates MCP definition files. tools.name: apollo_mcp_server
tools.description: The main Apollo MCP (Managed Control Plane) Server implementation. It serves as the core tool for running and managing Apollo"s Managed Control Plane services, facilitating data ingress, schema delivery, and orchestration for Apollo GraphQL gateway infrastructures. Primary use for organizations requiring advanced GraphQL federation, schema registry, and supergraph management.

annotations.title: Description of apollo_mcp_server. The main Apollo MCP (Managed Control Plane) Server implementation. Primary use for organizations requiring advanced GraphQL federation, schema registry, and supergraph management.

tools.name: GPT_CAD_Tool
tools.description: A tool leveraging large language models (LLMs) to interact with CAD software through an API. The tool converts natural language commands or queries into CAD actions and responses by mapping user text to specific CAD API calls. Example questions include: "Draw a rectangle of width 100 and height 50", "Move the circle 20 units to the right", or "What is the area of the selected object?". Keywords include: CAD automation, geometry drawing, natural language to CAD, API interaction.

annotations.title: Description of GPT_CAD_Tool. A tool leveraging large language models (LLMs) to interact with CAD software through an API. The tool converts natural language commands or queries into CAD actions and responses by mapping user text to specific CAD API calls. Example questions include: "Draw a rectangle of width 100 and height 50", "Move the circle 20 units to the right", or "What is the area of the selected object?". Keywords include: CAD automation, geometry drawing, natural language to CAD, API interaction.

tools.name: Text_to_CAD_Assistant
tools.description: A conversational AI assistant designed to help users create, modify, and interrogate CAD models using natural language queries. The tool interprets instructions such as "Create a 3D cylinder with radius 10 and height 30", "Add a hole in the center of the rectangle", or "List all layers in my drawing".

The main tool provided by this repository is the Hologres Management and Control Platform (MCP) server, which is designed for managing, monitoring, and controlling Alibaba Cloud Hologres services. The MCP server enables users to interact with Hologres resources, manage metadata, and coordinate service components.

The server is designed to facilitate the orchestration, monitoring, and management of complex data pipelines.

tools.name: mcp_server
tools.description: The core server application for MCP (Metrics Control Plane) providing a unified API to access, query, and manage time-series monitoring data from various backends such as Prometheus, Cortex, and Mimir. It acts as a bridge, enabling multi-cloud, multi-region monitoring with abstractions over metric sources. Sample use cases include: "How do I query a Prometheus metric from multiple clusters?", "Can I view dashboard metrics from both AWS and GCP in one place?", and typical keywords are "metrics aggregation", "prometheus proxy", "multi-backend metrics", and "monitoring API".

annotations.title: Description of mcp_server. The core server application for MCP (Metrics Control Plane) providing a unified API to access, query, and manage time-series monitoring data from various backends such as Prometheus, Cortex, and Mimir. It acts as a bridge, enabling multi-cloud, multi-region monitoring with abstractions over metric sources. Sample use cases include: "How do I query a Prometheus metric from multiple clusters?", "Can I view dashboard metrics from both AWS and GCP in one place?", and typical keywords are "metrics aggregation", "prometheus proxy", "multi-backend metrics", and "monitoring API".

tools.name: mcp_query_engine

Sample questions include: "Show me the sum of HTTP requests across cluster A and B", or "Compare CPU usage in Singapore and Frankfurt".

tools.name: DWS_MCP_Server
tools.description: The main server component of the "nutrient-dws-mcp-server" project. This tool provides a Management Control Plane (MCP) for the Nutrient DWS system, offering endpoints for lifecycle management, status, and configuration of resources. Typical usage includes managing services, handling requests, starting/stopping resource controllers, and monitoring health/status of connected nodes.

annotations.title: Description of DWS_MCP_Server. The main server component of the "nutrient-dws-mcp-server" project. This tool provides a Management Control Plane (MCP) for the Nutrient DWS system, offering endpoints for lifecycle management, status, and configuration of resources. Typical usage includes managing services, handling requests, starting/stopping resource controllers, and monitoring health/status of connected nodes.

tools.name: NodeController
tools.description: A core component responsible for managing the state and configuration of individual nodes in the DWS system. Its functionality includes registering nodes, updating their configuration, health probing, and supporting the creation, update, and deletion of node records through the control plane API.

tools.name: discover
tools.description: The Discover tool within MCP (Merchant Cost Portal) provides merchant intelligence about card network fees, rules, and assessments. This tool allows users to search for specific fees or rules using keywords, card network codes, or descriptions. Sample questions may include: "What is the assessment fee for Discover?" or "List Discover network rules about cross-border transactions."

tools.name: interchange
tools.description: The Interchange tool returns information about global interchange rates, including effective dates, card product names, merchant categories (MCC), transaction types, and relevant card networks. Users may search for the latest interchange rates, compare rates by region, or retrieve interchange tables. Sample queries: "What is the current interchange for MCC 5411 on Visa?" or "List MasterCard retail interchange rates."

tools.name: sql
tools.description: The SQL tool enables users to execute SQL statements directly against SingleStore databases. It is capable of handling queries such as SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, and others, allowing for ad-hoc data retrieval, modification, or schema management. Sample questions include: "SELECT * FROM users WHERE age > 30", "INSERT INTO orders (id, amount) VALUES (123, 500)", "UPDATE products SET price = price * 0.9 WHERE category = "Electronics"". Keywords to trigger this tool are: "query", "run SQL", "select", "insert", "update", "delete", "execute statement", "describe table".

annotations.title: Description of sql. The SQL tool enables users to execute SQL statements directly against SingleStore databases. It is capable of handling queries such as SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, and others, allowing for ad-hoc data retrieval, modification, or schema management. Sample questions include: "SELECT * FROM users WHERE age > 30", "INSERT INTO orders (id, amount) VALUES (123, 500)", "UPDATE products SET price = price * 0.9 WHERE category = "Electronics"". Keywords to trigger this tool are: "query", "run SQL", "select", "insert", "update", "delete", "execute statement", "describe table".

tools.name: database
tools.description: The database tool helps users manage and explore SingleStore databases. It supports tasks such as listing all available databases, connecting or switching to a certain database, and displaying database-related metadata. Sample interactions include: "List all databases", "Switch to customer_db", "Show me the available databases". Trigger keywords include: "databases", "list databases", "switch database", "connect database", "show databases".

annotations.title: Description of database. The database tool helps users manage and explore SingleStore databases. Trigger keywords include: "databases", "list databases", "switch database", "connect database", "show databases".

tools.name: table
tools.description: The table tool allows users to explore and manage tables within a specified database. It supports listing tables, describing table schema, and showing details like columns and indexes. Example queries: "List all tables in sales_db", "Describe the table called transactions", "What columns does the users table have?". Keywords to use this tool: "list tables", "show tables", "describe table", "table schema", "table columns", "table info".

tools.name: mcp_agent
tools.description: The MCP Agent is a component designed to be installed on a managed host. It allows the MCP (Management Control Plane) to perform actions, such as executing scripts, collecting information, and managing configuration on remote YDB nodes. Common use cases involve software installation, health checks, and orchestrating upgrades. Sample keywords/questions: "How do I install mcp-agent?", "Can the agent run shell scripts on its host?", "Configuration management on YDB nodes".

Common use cases involve software installation, health checks, and orchestrating upgrades. Sample keywords/questions: "How do I install mcp-agent?", "Can the agent run shell scripts on its host?", "Configuration management on YDB nodes".

tools.name: mcp_controller
tools.description: The MCP Controller is the main orchestrator of the Management Control Plane system. It communicates with managed agents, tracks their status, applies desired configurations, and coordinates actions across multiple hosts and clusters. It is typically deployed as a service that supervises large-scale YDB deployments. Sample keywords/questions: "Cluster management automation", "How does mcp-controller coordinate updates?", "Centralized orchestration for YDB".
